1.review: Great place to stop on and get some food. Sat down right away and placed my order. Good came out quick and full of flavor. Staff was very friendly too and attentive.
1.name: Anthony Krupocin

2.review: The food was very good, and I had plenty of leftovers. The place was quiet and the staff was very friendly. The batter on the chicken was good, but for me it was not quite the taste I was expecting. Maybe I am too used to American-style sweet & sour chicken. I would definitely go back again.
2.name: Joshua Washburn

3.review:
Is there any way give them less then one star?
Service : poor, upto the point very first minute, serving plate throwing manner. Of course did not say sorry to me. 
Food:  what do you expect from them? I called them asked if this is how it supposed be? They said yes. Then, no expectations, just leave. No point to argue. 
I don't think they expect anyone as 2nd visits
3.name: ilsuk kwag

4.review: We really enjoyed our dinner here with friends. We had spicy seafood soup, chicken brocolli, noodle with brown sauce, fried dumplings and kimchi. - the food were generous and tasty. Service friendly and attentive. Overall, will definitely return.
4.name: Neva Mccormick

5.review: Simply, don't go to this irritating place. Worst service, poor food quality and high price! You will definitely feel bad once you go there!
5.name: SY Shim

6.review: First of all, when I ordered my meal which was Pineapple fried rice with fried Tofu they charged me the regular price fifteen dollars then shortly returned to say I need to pay three dollars extra for tofu therefore bringing my lunch total up to eighteen dollars. I quickly said just add the shrimp...now when I got my meal the shrimp where baby shrimp nothing like the picture and the Pineapples where canned not fresh cut pineapples like all other Thai restaurants.  I asked for sweet and sour sauce they gave me duck sauce as if it were a Chinese restaurant...so annoyed a complete waste of fifteen dollars...never would I reccomend this place nor will I return!!
6.name: Monique Moody

7.review: I, absolutely, do not recommend this restaurant. Service was mediocre and food was of poor quality and overly greasy. Plates were brought 10 minutes apart from each other and mine 30 minutes after everyone was done eating. The flavor was completely unacceptable, bland and sub par to any Korean restaurant. Never again!
7.name: Ivan J. Zapata-Rivera

8.review: I like noodles and this place has noodles. You want Chinese Korean food then come here. It’s pricey compared to queens but we in the city and it’s city money so. But the food is okay for what it is. You want a review, it’s a 3 star place that offers food. If you want or need food you go get it. Noodles and the fried beef with sweet sauce. Chinese Korean food. Food came hot and well prepared. No dirty bowls and the eating place was well set up. 6:10:1
8.name: Young ko

9.review: I have never been so disrespected and discriminated against in my life I walked in and was seated down with my table lady asked us what we wanted without giving us any menus then as we place our ordered while the restaurant was still empty we place a order of pad Thai the restaurant was flooded with about 20 people about 5min after we ordered we waited at the table for about 20 min everyone who walked in after us had food I tried to get up and just leave but one lady stopped me and said they are making the food but then another 12min go by with 8 plates of food coming out of the kitchen and 2 other tables getting served before us that’s when I had enough and got up and walked up by far worst experience I’ve had in NYC this place is terrible DONT come here if you want to feel comfortable eating your food
9.name: marvin rodriguez

10.review: My boyfriend, myself, and my best friend with his children went to there for some thai food. We were super excited as it is close to our hotel and specifically waited to go there. When we got there, they sat us in this little corner and the lady came over and was like what do you want to order without even giving us menus. We asked for menus she came back over and we told them that the kids were gonna go next door but that we wanted to order. We all placed our order and about 10 plus minutes later a group of about 15 to 20 people came in. Every one of them was addressed and acknowledged prior to us. Then there was 2 tables next to us that came in after us and were treated and acknowledged and recieved their food prior to us. Another two more tables came in after us, ordered the all of their food was delivered while we were still waiting for our own! we questioned where it was and was just told it is coming. The party of about 20 people that came in also all received all of their food and appetizers and drinks still no food was brought out to our table for a party of only 3. When we asked again where everything was for the 2nd time  as we mentioned that we were getting ready to leave they kept saying it's gonna come, it's going to come. at that point we finally decided that this is not a place that we want to be at. we were being ignored and our food order was completely missing and there was no accountability! sadly we left went to another Thai restaurant which ended up being amazing!
10.name: Adrienne Cochran

11.review: We just stopped in for a quick bite for the children. Our special request was for just a bowl of broth and a plate of noodles.
11.name: Seth Blanck

12.review: I came here to eat pho b/c it was conveniently across the street and they had a huge sign that they serve pho.  Against all of my intuition and my common sense I decided it was a good idea to try the pho out at a Korean restaurant.  I shouldn't really have to say how it went.  It's literally a bland bowl of MSG soup with salt that borderlines diabetic shock, a few pieces of paltry beef meat and mush noodles.  The accoutrements were a joke.  Whoever says this is a great place to eat pho has no concept of what pho really is.  I'd rather eat sandpaper out of a bowl of dog water than come back here.  GtFO with your "We Serve Pho" sign.  I got duped tho.  Well played.
12.name: Godfrey Lee

13.review: I was craving black bean noodles when I visited because I love jjajangmyun. Theirs was delicious but the other foods weren't as good of quality compared to it; their tonkatsu was a bit tough and difficult to chew.
13.name: Tiffany Lee

14.review: The noodles are actually really good. It was cool to be able to get a split bowl between jajangmyeon and jjampong. Fast service and casual setting—good for families.
14.name: Michelle

15.review:
This place is my secret vice. 

Whenever I find myself in the area, even if I have a lunch or dinner engagement close in time, I would pop in for a bowl of jamppong and maybe a side of their sweet and sour beef. 

Personally, I like being left alone by servers unless I need something. Because of that, this place is great for me to enjoy my meal alone.
15.name: Carmen Lau

16.review: The salt and pepper wings are amazing!   We have had many of the main dishes but my favorite has to be the kung pao scallops!  Delicious food with friendly service!!!
16.name: Natosha Jacobs

17.review: I had jjajangmyeon and tangsuyuk combo. Really expensive from my point of view for that combo (I definitely paid over $15 for it), but I suppose I should take into consideration that it is NYC and cost in general is going to be crazy high, plus the fact that if I were to eat this in South Korea (Which is certainly quite cheaper), this would almost be non-issue. HOWEVER! I was really in a mood for the food, and I liked the taste. So four stars by me for hitting the spot.
17.name: Grant Chun

18.review:
There food is quality and have always had a great experience will
Continue to order generals tsu chicken it's amazing.
18.name: Leamarie Dawson

19.review: Pretty good food. Don't know if was the msg or what but i couldn't stop eating it. Place is nice and clean big tvs all over. But no peanuts in kung pow. That's odd.
19.name: Daniel Ward

20.review:
The shrimp pad thai is quite delicious. 15 small shrimps in a $15 pad thai. What I like BEST is the hot sauce and hot chilli powder (my favorite). I normally wouldn't go to an asian fusian restaurant when I'm in koreatown, I'd usually choose an authentic Korean restaurant.  But I am so glad I found this when I happened to be craving for pad thai. 
**Bonus points for having power outlets available just when we needed it most!!
20.name: Kelly Chen

21.review: Wasn't all that impressed with the food and they really skimp on those flavorful side dishes that are generously offered at the other Korean restaurants in the area. Dining space is cramped with too many tables. Service was pleasant but not particularly speedy.
21.name: G Aquino

22.review: This place is the best for giant bowls of spicy Korean noodles. My favorite is the Extra Seafood Spicy Noodle soup. Service is great and the dishes are delicious.
22.name: daniel lam

23.review: Found by accident while in the area, but WOW that was good! Excellent service, and incredible food!
23.name: Abby Langehennig

24.review: Outstanding place for korean food. Very tasty. Service is consistently great. It has a good atmosphere.
24.name: jaden seymour

25.review: Excellent chinese korean food, good price. Basically a korean chinese neighborhood restaurant, not fancy not bad.
25.name: Carlos A. Rivera-Jones

26.review: This is the worst  asian restaurant ever. Their fraud chicken is ridiculous. There was nearly no meat whatsoever. When I showed it to the server he literally accused me of not understanding in food and  asian cuisine. Absolutely ridiculous.  He came back and then  offered  to take it off the bill I said I will pay and then he insisted to take it off the bill then when I went to pay it was included!!!
26.name: Kha- lË-daton

27.review: Authentic Korean Chinese food - reasonable price and huge amount of food!
27.name: Jinwoong Hwang

29.review: Terrific Korean-Chinese fushion place-the best in NY I have tried.  Ja Jiang noodles is terrific.  The soup base for thr Champ Bong is awesome.  Their noodles themselves are really good quality.  Other dishes, such as the fried dumplings, are very good as well.
29.name: William Lu

30.review: Fast service and super delicious!! I'll be back.
30.name: Lane Brettschneider

31.review: Casual place, stopped in to take advantage of the beer and fried chicken special but got upsold to the fried chicken and garlic pepper sauce with a bottle of soju for $23.  Very good recommendation I would say.   Topped off with the noodles with brown sauce as their specialty and it was an economically satisfying night.
31.name: David Chin

32.review: I go here far too often,  but the food is delicious. Definitely worth giving a try.
32.name: I'adorher Robins

33.review: Food is excellent price is good
33.name: Robert Cha

34.review: They force you to tip higher than you would like. Food is delicious
34.name: Davin Kim

35.review: Very good Korean food, known for their jajameun... Never disappoints.. Probably the best I've ever had
35.name: Chu Lin

36.review: Do not go there. Like street food. Taste bad. And they will ask you for tips.
36.name: fedex never

37.review: Great and amazing food! We got seated at 7pm right away. Staff was very friendly and attentive and food portions are big! Highly recommend! Fills you up without you feeling bloated after!
37.name: Brandon Arp

38.review: If you’re in the mood for a good korean Chinese meal. Big portions and family style
38.name: graceeunjoo .

39.review: Solid 짜장면 but come for the 짬뽕 and get loads of seafood. You pay Manhattan prices but you get quality food.
39.name: Brian Lee

41.review:
Decent place to eat. Went with some friend who wanted to try it. I wasn’t blown away by the food. Our server was nice and help.

We had:
Fried Dumplings (Pretty good)
General Tso (mmm a lil bland)
Chicken Pineapple Fried Rice (good, but not flavorful) and 
2 Korean dishes that were popular. One was pork with noodles and the other was seafood with noodles in a red sauce.

In the table that we sat smelled old and had this old cat smell which was a turn off. I wouldn’t visit again but I do appreciate having good service.
41.name: Devonta White

42.review: Delicious Korean noodles~ portion is big too.   Love both the spicy seafood noodles and the mix noodles.   Spicy noodles are not too spicy.
42.name: Grace Hung

43.review: This place is on the way from my work to the subway so I often come here to have dinner before I go back home.  Very reasonable priced and the service is nice.
43.name: Mark Lee

44.review:
I came here from Michigan to try spicy seafood noodle soup. That does tell how good the food is. I tried several other locations located in other states as well, others cannot mimic the same taste, but this place knows the good taste is not from spices but from extremely fresh seafood which they prepare daily. This is a must stop whenever I visit NYC. 

For Korean friends, this is the place you smooth your nostalgic craving on noodles
44.name: S Lee

45.review: Food took a long time to come out, the staff kept apologizing, a little expensive and food wasn't great.  Run of the mill lunch stop.
45.name: KP

46.review: Quality of food and service is too unreliable.  Not worth the chance.
46.name: Andy Park

47.review: Hyo Dong Gak has great tasting food, a large and diverse Asian menu, convenient operating hours, quick service, and friendly staff.
47.name: Jason Atkinson

48.review: Found mold in their chilli powder, it wasn't a big deal for them, very disappointing.... watch carefully.
48.name: Soo Chang

49.review: This is the place that I never want to visit again. The food tasted really bad and also the clerks were unkind.
49.name: Minseo Chae

50.review: Great service and Chinese food was tasty!
50.name: David V

51.review: Definitely not LGBTQ+ friendly. Heard some workers/owners whispering about “a girl who is dressed like a boy” there. Food is decent but pricy, and customer service was barely acceptable. Unfriendly. Go somewhere else.
51.name: Jae-won Jo

53.review:
I found a COCKROACH in Jjambong.               Seriously. So disgusting. I can imagine how clean their kitchen is. When i called them, the first word that she said was omg. Not even said sorry. And she wanted to give me some credits for future orders. Are you kidding me? Does she think that im gonna order again at this disgusting place? I was in shock. I asked them to refund the full amount. They hesitated and asked me to bring all dishes with the COCKROACH to the restaurant. WTH. I was soooo pissed. They dont know how to serve their customers. 

I wanna give them -5 stars. 

DO NOT ORDER ANY FOOD FROM THIS RESTAURANT if you dont wanna eat COCKROACH.
53.name: Irene Hwang

54.review: Ok. Steamed dumpling flavor was off, not cured by the soy sauce.  Dishes were gloppy.
54.name: Peter Wharton

55.review: Black sauce noodle is kind of expensive...
55.name: Shane Moon

56.review: This is an excellent place to eat pho. The restaurant is Korean but they have a small menu of Vietnamese and Thai dishes. For the price you cannot beat it.
56.name: Kristen Przybylski

57.review: Love the spicy and bean noodle with chicken combo
57.name: M K

58.review: It's decent but not the best of any specific Asian cuisine.
58.name: Dzung Nguyen

59.review: My friend recommended this place and he was right. Great jjampong and tangsooyuk. Would love to try again when I come back to New York
59.name: Minsoon Choi

60.review: On the basis that I had used a Groupon this place was good.  Portion size of the noodles is huge and were decent in flavor.  Dumplings were okay, the skin was excellent however the filling was a bit tasteless.
60.name: Hubert Eng

62.review: I used to be a Shanghai-mong customer but since they've changed the management and the food started to taste like non-Korean chinese food, I stopped going and switched back to Hyo Dong Gak.  The food here is consistent and the price is reasonable.  I would visit there again.  They can improve the ambient a little, though.
62.name: Thomas J. Lee

63.review: My absolute favorite! Spicy seafood noodle soup is a must!
63.name: MIRJANA VICARI

65.review: Food is okay and they deliver too.
65.name: Kenny Park

66.review: It has awesome Jjampong, spicy seafood noodle soup, and also the portion is generous for its price. Also try their pho menu, which tastes pretty great.
66.name: J S

67.review:
I am giving it a 3 Star because I am not a big fan of Korean Chinese food. I think it is a cheap steal from authentic Chinese food but I guess when you have to wait over half an hour for Korean BBQ or Tofu stew in the nearby restaurants, this is the place to go if you have no patience or are dying of hunger. 

We ordered one spicy seafood noodle soup, one jiajianmen, and one sweet and sour spicy chicken for three people. The spicy seafood noodle soup comes in a giant bowl with tons of chewy noodles and light but spicy broth. There are plenty of shrimp and squid in it. It is definitely enough for 3 or 4 people. The Jiajianmen is obviously the Korean interpretation and it is decent but not my cup of tea. 

My favorite is their fried spicy sweet and sour chicken. It comes in a very generous portion again and is very delicious. Overall, the food is decent but honestly, I would prefer real Korean food rather than Korean Chinese food any day.
67.name: Athena Chang

68.review: Their spicy noodle soup did not work for me with its high level of sodium.
68.name: jay kim

69.review: A quick meal and rather generic asian joint in the middle of the coorporate jungle. There's nothing too special about this place, but at the very least the portions are huge, definitely enough to split for two meals.
69.name: An Z

70.review: we ordered take out and found it to be of good value.  good food at a good price...especially for New York.
70.name: JP Benedict

71.review: Good Lunch Special but the service needs to improve. Also this place needs to work on their cleanliness.
71.name: Felix

72.review:
Korean-chinese restaurant ilon the outskirts of Ktown. I went there with my coworker for lunch during the week and it wasn't too crowded. There was enough people to reassure you that it's a decent place but not so much that you're waiting a long time to be seated and you don't have to shout to your friend to make yourself heard. 
I ordered the half and half JJA jjan myung and jjam bbong. I was so happy to see they have an option for that because anyone who goes to Korean/Chinese restaurant, they're familiar with the torn struggle between the two. You always want both. 
Service and food was good. Price is really good for the portion they gave us.
72.name: Annie Oh

73.review: My wife and I went here as it was next door to our hotel. The food was excellent. The breading on the General Tso's chicken was wonderful, and the shrimp lo mein was excellent as well. There were a LOT of Oriental people eating there and more that came in as we were eating, which to me is an indication that this is good, authentic cuisine. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and the price was very reasonable.
73.name: Keith Murray

74.review: Nice Korean Food and reasonable price
74.name: Rodger Chuah

75.review: Very good corean food. The size is amazing and low price, very recommendable!!!
75.name: Folka México

76.review: I enjoyed my rice and stew.
76.name: Dami Ajayi

78.review: Something changed badly. I enjoyed this restaurent once or twice a month. Recently the taste of the foods became very bad for me. It was the best Korean chinese food in NYC. Now the worst. Very disappointing this time.
78.name: Mark Pak

79.review: Great food and service and location. Price is right too.
79.name: Gary Miliefsky

80.review: As a Korean, I have to divulge a secret about this place. It's Chinese-Korean cuisine. This is my go to place for 2 of the most popular dishes in Korea that few non-Koreans know about. They're jjajangmyeon and jjanpong.  You'll notice that when you walk in these two are primarily what Koreans order because that's what Koreans like to eat from Chinese-Korean cuisine.  I advise all my friends to order only these two dishes as the rest of the dishes are average at best.  I give it 5 stars because it is the only place in Manhattan that serves the two dishes I mentioned.  Otherwise you'll have to trek to Queens or cross the GW Bridge to get to Fort Lee/Palisades for this stuff.
80.name: Zeno Lee

81.review:
Two words: pad thai.
The pickles they give you before your meal add a nice touch, but this is apparently a Chinese "fusion" spot in the guise of of a Korean restaurant. If you're feeling korean bbq, don't bother. That said, they're willing to order it from the actual korean place next door and serve it to you in their place :p
81.name: Cai Tomlinson

82.review: Worst jjajjangmyun ever including Korea I tried. Have it in-store but eww...
82.name: Sung Hwan Joo

84.review: probably the best Chinese Korean restaurant in K-town area.
84.name: Seung Mun

86.review: It's okay here but not too great
86.name: John Kim

87.review: Best Jjambbong in my life! I go there every week:)
87.name: YUNA LEE

89.review: This is a Korean style Chinese! Don't rate it down for not having orange chicken! :(
89.name: Ahyoung Kim

90.review:
Despite the korean name, the food was chinese. Despite the menu being in chinese, the staff did not seem comfortable with me ordering in chinese and one dude ran away when I asked if they had green beans. Despite the myriad dishes on the menu, everything was uniformly covered in the same brown glop.

Funny place.
90.name: Eric Minikel

91.review: My nephews favorite restaurant. Sweet and spicy pork is a favorite.
91.name: Richard Chun

92.review: Obsolete. Now that Dong Chun Hong is available.
92.name: Douglas Park

93.review: Spicy seafood noodle soup extremely good
93.name: Sebastiano Peluso

94.review: Best Korean style chinese food in nyc.
94.name: Heigenberg HP

95.review: the Worst service, worst delivery and most terrible attitude toward customers.
95.name: SC Shin

99.review:
(Translated by Google) Order and from where in 40 minutes.
We opened and sat down for the second time, so our order is missing. I don't come out until I eat out all the other tables.
I was forced to tip because of the tip culture of American beggars.

The food Fine.I had it.
I ate three samganjjangjang / samseon pepper champon / gun dumpling.
I was a little jajangmyeon Singer wotgo gunmandu is eaten warm with fried liver it was delicious even in less than a mandupi.
Champong was delicious as eolkeun.

(Original)
주문하고 40분 만에 나온 곳.
저희가 오픈하고 두 번 째로 자리에 앉았는데 저희 오더가 누락되었나봐요. 다른 테이블들 다 먹고 나갈 때 까지 안나오다가 말하니까 이제서야 조리,,,
미국의 거지같은 팁 문화때문에 어쩔 수 없이 팁 드렸네요.

음식은 괜찮았어요.
삼선간짜장/삼선고추짬뽕/군만두 이렇게 먹었어요.
짜장면은 좀 싱거웠고 군만두는 만두피에 아예 간이 안되어있었는데 따뜻하게 튀겨진 맛으로 먹었어요.
짬뽕은 얼큰하게 맛있었습니다.
99.name: SEOHUI KIM

100.review:
(Translated by Google) The champon was a bit lukewarm, but it was good to eat

(Original)
짬뽕이 좀 미지근했지만 먹을만했고(겨울에갔을때 엄청 뜨끈하게 맛있게먹었었는데 여름이라 미지근하게 주신건가..) 탕수육이 참 쫄깃하니 맛있었당
100.name: Mini C

101.review:
(Translated by Google) I ordered pork gas. The meat is low quality and fried to hide the weakness. The rice is crunchy, and the salad will tell you how long you are using the vegetables. But it's not much of a sheep. I still have a service job and I'm pushing the tip.

(Original)
제가 주문한건 돈가스인데요. 고기는 질이 낮고 튀김으로 빈약함을 감추려고합니다. 밥은 푸석하구요 샐러드는 얼마나 오래됀 채소를 쓰는지 쭈글쭈글합니다. 그렇다고 양이 많은것도아니에요. 그래도 서비스업한답시고 팁까지 강요하네요
101.name: Jake Kang

102.review:
(Translated by Google) Chanpon is delicious ~ I think I did not put a lot of seasoning, so it was nice to have a cheer after eating! I will be going again next time

(Original)
짬뽕 맛있어요~ 조미료를 많이 안 넣은것 같아 먹고나서도 속이 편해서 좋았어요! 다음에 또 갈 예정입니다
102.name: IAN KIM

103.review:
(Translated by Google) It tastes like Champon Jjajang. Gyoza is delicious.

(Original)
짬뽕 짜장 맛잇엇요. 군만두가 맛잇어요.
103.name: eunah kim

104.review:
(Translated by Google) Exactly

(Original)
Exact ce trebuie
104.name: stefan petrut

105.review:
(Translated by Google) This house is by far the best in Korean cuisine in Manhattan.
A delicious Chinese restaurant we think of, just like that.
I am always worried about it, but after eating it, I enjoy it both ways and always get very satisfied. It is very pleasing to pounding before eating, because the flow of polish on the surface of the jelly. Champong is also very satisfied with the delicious taste compared to the view, pounding ground. Well, if you do not talk about the sweet and sour pork, you will pour the sauce and eat it as a side dish. Do not forget to sell it, and ask for the sauce separately. I do not eat fried rice in Chinese restaurant well, but when I see my friend emptying out, fried rice is delicious. Open your first drink and "drink it." . Free delivery is also available for reference.

(Original)
맨해튼 내에서 한국식 중국요리는 이 집이 단연 으뜸.
우리가 생각하는 맛있는 중국집, 딱 그런 집임.
늘 고민하다가 짬짜면을 먹고 나오는데, 양쪽 다 맛있어서 늘 매우 만족하면서 나옴. 짜장면에 윤기가 좌르르 흐르는 것이, 먹기 전부터 매우 만족 땅땅땅. 짬뽕도 보기에 비해 맛있게 매워서 또 매우 만족 땅땅땅. 참참, 탕수육은 따로 말하지 않으면 소스를 부어서 부먹으로 먹게 되니 주의할 것. 찍먹파는 잊지 말고 소스를 따로 달라고 해야 함. 난 중국집에서 파는 볶음밥은 잘 안 먹는데, 내 친구는 싹싹 비우는걸 보면, 볶음밥도 맛있나봄. 첫 술 뜨고 "마시써." 라고 함. 참고로 free delivery도 가능함.
105.name: Courtney Kim

106.review:
(Translated by Google) You need to know history.

(Original)
역사를 알아야 한다.
106.name: 방룡

107.review:
(Translated by Google) It is a good place to eat when you miss the taste of Korea in America because of the taste of old mackerel. As most American restaurants have a lot of sheep, it is likely that you will be able to give it to those who visited in Korea. Service fireflies.
I had been a customer of this restaurant for a several years.
However, I had a terrible unpleasant experience today.
I had ordered my food at 7:08 PM and waited for one and half hour although the estimate delivery time was 30 mins to 45 mins. So, I called the restaurant and complained about the delay, asked for a reasonable explanation. What they said was ridiculous; they never apologized and just forced me to be more patient, and later they actually got mad at me.
What a horrible service !!
I wish YOU would be another victim of this shitty service.

서비스 개똥망.
